intro: Cerastium alpinum var. glutinosum, commonly known as sticky rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered with glandular hairs that produce a sticky substance. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with a waxy coating. This variety is well adapted to rocky and dry habitats, thriving in full sun and exhibiting frost resistance.
